entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot: Week 7
entry.content: A rather early morning walk in Holyrood Park to Saint Anthony's Chapel. A tactic of morning desperation to try to get Mini-M to have a long lie - but even the threat of climbing hills at 7am didn't really encourage her to stay in bed. She did take a lovely photo though!

entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot Week 6
entry.content:
We're only a few weeks in to 2014, and already I think we're a bit confused with the weeks / dates. Oops. To be honest, I've no idea how it's the middle of February - I'm sure there must have been a time portal that skipped from about 8th Jan to 8th Feb! So, I think we're onto Week 6 of Mini-M's photos.
We went to see the light installation that is currently in St Andrew's Square - it's a whole field of coloured light wands that phase through different colours. She was very excited. We loved it but wished it have been about 20 degrees warmer and we could have sat about all evening with a glass of wine enjoying it and oohing and aahing over the pretty colours. Instead we shivered around whilst wrapped up with hats, scarfs, gloves and only managed 2 constantly moving circuits before we thought we were going to get hypothermia.

entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot Week 5
entry.content: Unintentionally kaleidoscopic photo of Playmobil pirate parts on the carpet. Or what happens when you swing the camera about wildly whilst taking pictures. Other offerings from the same shoot included a few of the camera strap in front of the lens, some knee "selfies" and a few carpet fluff macros. None actually of the Playmobil pirate ship which Mini-M was apparently taking a photo of…

entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot Week 4
entry.content:
Sunshine :o) Much excitement because the outdoor grass sculpture at the Gallery of Modern Art wasn't closed due to high winds this time. Happy days. A small moment of two of dissent as Mini-M really wanted to run, and the sign said no running. She eventually conceded that she didn't really want to end up cold, wet and soggy after falling in, and that was one of the likely consequences of running.
Unrelatedly on the way there in the car, Mini-M pointed out the window and exclaimed that she could see "a pigeon sky party" after a large flock of them took off together. What a great description - life would sound much more exciting if everyone used vocabulary like toddlers do…

entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot Week 3
entry.content:
We had a grandparent visiting weekend down in the Borders. Displaying some geographical confusion, according to Mini-M, this is apparently Granny F's "whole house".

Unless there is a lot she's not telling us, and she has won mega bucks on the lottery and bought the entire town, what it actually is actually most of Hawick.

entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot Week 2
entry.content:
I have a feeling that there may be a recurring theme in Mini-M's photos - staged scenes with her toys.
This one is a Peppa Pig / Lego combo. That's a surefire way to keep both Mini-M and Mr E entertained then…

entry.title: Mini-M's Snapshot Week 1
entry.content:
Mini-M is in charge of the photo cataloguing this year. She's got our old camera, and we're aiming for 1 picture for each week.

So… week 1. She directed the staging of this shot, then clicked the shutter - it specifically contains 3 things:
  1. Her new cuddly toy - and don't make the mistake of calling it a deer - it is most definitely a fawn (she'll correct you)
  2. The new lamp we bought in IKEA to make mealtimes less dingy. She is disproportionately excited by it.
  3. Mr E's injured finger - week 1 and we've clocked up 2014s first trip to A&E already. I'll not shame him by explaining the specifics, but let's just say not many people could manage to cut themselves on their deodorant!

entry.title: 31st December
entry.content:
It's my last daily photo of 2013. I've decided I'm not doing it in 2014. Now that I'm working full time, rather than part time, there are far fewer interesting things to take photos of!

So I shall sign off from the photos with this one, of a poster made by Mr E and Mini-M, for a missing furby. We found it in the street and put it through the wash. Mini-M thought very altruistically that its owner might be sad, but is also secretly hoping they don't see the poster and phone to claim it…

entry.title: 30th December
entry.content: A holiday hit of the culinary variety - bacon and stout jam (recipe to follow soon on Makey-Cakey)

entry.title: 29th December
entry.content: What a pair of cheeky little Princesses!

entry.title: 28th December
entry.content: Mini-M outside Granny F's classroom. We went to the swing park, but didn't realise there as rugby on and it was all a bit mental, so made a strategic parking detour to the school. The weather was grim (hence the wellies, rain coat, hat, scarf Michelin man look), the river was high, and it was the fastest flowing game of Pooh Sticks I've seen in a while - but the main thing was, it was some fresh air for us all - vital in avoiding Mini-M meltdowns we have discovered.

entry.title: 27th December
entry.content: A rare selfie. Although actually not, since I didn't take it! My sister did, whilst trying to master the automatic smile detection setting on the camera.

entry.title: 26th December
entry.content: Boxing Day saw us heading south (only a little bit!) to visit the complete grandparent, aunt and uncle complement for over a few hectic days. There were some very creatively wrapped presents still under the tree for us too! (Thanks Auntie L)

entry.title: 25th December
entry.content: Christmas Day - at the zoo! Baby koala and big cats being given Christmas Presents (aka dead guinea pigs wrapped up in boxes) were the highlights. But didn't photograph terribly well - so instead it's our ugly mugs in front of a whole lot of picture penguins!

entry.title: 24th December
entry.content: Christmas Eve - bread dough ready to rise over night for Christmas Dinner chelsea buns for our Christmas Day zoo trip.

entry.title: 23rd December
entry.content: Fail! No photo. Bad weather, bad toddler attitude, general non-festive grumpiness. So let's gloss over that and have a moment of 'my hasn't she grown' by looking at Mini-M from my 2011 daily photos (age 17 months). I checked Mr E's from last year - it was of a bit of old map… wasn't sure of the significance, so delved further back for cuteness' sake.

entry.title: 22nd December
entry.content: Dressed up and ready to go to dinner for Mr E's work Christmas do. The worrying thing about this photo is that despite wearing 3 inch heels, I still look teeny - I think I'm shrinking!

entry.title: 21st December
entry.content: Running an imaginary cafe/campsite in the play area of the Polish shop. Good job, since the queues were epic! Mini-M provided a fair amount of entertainment to numerous small Polish kids, who seemed to be taking it turns to be dared to speak to her, but bottling out at the last minute, and instead just running up, standing a little distance away (or indeed behind her) and smiling! I think Scottish kids might be a bit of an unusual occurrence there...

entry.title: 20th December
entry.content: Party dress on and all ready for the nursery Christmas party and Carol Concert.

entry.title: 19th December
entry.content: Mini-M with her clipboard, undertaking a survey of the neighbourhood Christmas decorations. Not entirely sure we should be encouraging bureaucratic tendencies in a 3 year old, however she certainly seemed to enjoy it!

entry.title: 18th December
entry.content: End of term nursery parcels wrapped and ready to give. Wrapped in Mini-M artwork, since she seems to currently be going for quantity and speed over quality, and we're drowning in a pile of glittery, painty paper!

entry.title: 17th December
entry.content: Mr E went to London for a meeting - this is his flight, on the way home!

entry.title: 16th December
entry.content: A sock snowman and some Christmas cards to open waiting for Mini-M to arrive home from nursery.

entry.title: 15th December
entry.content: Christmas party fun - playing catch the tinsel tail.

entry.title: 14th December
entry.content: Mini-M dressed herself: jumpsuit, party dress, hi-top trainers, white appliqué cardigan (not visible), fleece and hat. She looks like a Gouranga lady (and just about as happy too!).

entry.title: 13th December
entry.content: An evening of culture at the Usher Hall - I went with a friend and her Mum to see the RSNO play Brahms with Nicola Benedetti and Leondard Elschenbroich. The music was lovely, and the building is fab.

entry.title: 12th December
entry.content: North Pole cupcakes - decorated by Mini-M to take along to the Christmas jumper and baking day at Mr E's work.

entry.title: 11th December
entry.content: Preparation for the craft activities for the kids Christmas Party on Sunday afternoon… the recipe for Magic Reindeer Food.

entry.title: 10th December
entry.content:
We've been trying to join in with Advent Challenge 2013 via the Faye Brown Designs blog.
Each day in December up until Christmas, there is a different festive theme to do something creative with. On 10th December we were in fact playing catch up for the 8th December, whose theme was "Your favourite Christmas song" which in Mini-M's case is Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer. So we made these reindeer faces. I have to say that it does look suspiciously like there has been a lot of reindeer marrying their cousins (!) in the Rudolph family tree, and to be honest, several may be alien impostor reindeer. They were lots of fun to make though.

entry.title: 9th December
entry.content: A tea picnic underneath the Christmas tree to cheer Mini-M up after a tough day at nursery. Very festive, but made slightly weirder by the fact that our Christmas tree is situated on the top landing, just outside the bathroom door. And we were joined in our picnic by a 3ft wooden otter.

entry.title: 8th December
entry.content: Two little woodland sprites / squirrels / monkeys in a big old tree.

entry.title: 7th December
entry.content: Fireworks over the town square as part of the Scott's Selkirk celebrations.

entry.title: 6th December
entry.content: PJ-ed up at Granny F's, waiting for Team H to arrive. All very exciting...

entry.title: 5th December
entry.content: Surprisingly organised for us for once… the first of the Christmas presents wrapped and ready to be delivered during a weekend visit down to the grandparents.

entry.title: 4th December
entry.content: A work training event at the Falkirk Wheel today. A lovely venue - we even got to have our afternoon workshop group in a barge due to a shortage of meeting rooms!

entry.title: 3rd December
entry.content: Posting pennies in the guide dog collection. Mini-M has given the puppies names and talks to them whenever we go. Last time she managed to win over some elderly gentleman to give her all of his spare pennies too to post in.

entry.title: 2nd December
entry.content: Christmas presents in progress - shortbread crumble fudge wrapped and labelled

entry.title: 1st December
entry.content: A bit of a surprise at the swing park! I'm not sure who was more surprised - the cat or us...

entry.title: 30th November
entry.content: Happy St Andrew's Day! Mini-M and I baked for the occasion. Saltire cupcakes were iced before 8am - this early morning cake decorating is becoming a worrying habit…

entry.title: 29th November
entry.content: No photos today - oops! Blaming the stinking cold that is hanging about and filling my head with cotton wool. Time travelling forwards to steal one from the 30th… we went skating again - this time Mini-M was very happy to be zoomed about the ice by Uncle P who is a much more proficient skater than either Mr E or myself.

entry.title: 28th November
entry.content:
A video today - if technology plays ball. Better than the photo I took of my 'desk' aka laptop and tissue strewn bed, as I worked from home and sneezed and coughed my way through another day! 

Instead, Mini-M went to see Captain Flynn and the Pirate Dinosaurs this morning, and the rest of the day has had a rather pirate-y feel to it. Eye patch. Hook. Arrrgh Me Hearties!

entry.title: 27th November
entry.content: A day of annual leave whilst feeling under the weather with an evil cold meant no ambitious projects tackled, but the tupperware drawer at least slightly tamed.

entry.title: 26th November
entry.content: Met a friend after they finished work in town, which meant I was able to have a quick trip to Real Foods which used to me my lunch break distraction several times a week when I worked just around the corner. It's such an brilliant shop - I could spend hours there, just looking in curiosity and awe at all of the things they stock (and most likely purchasing a selection of random dairy-free chocolate and tofu based products!)

entry.title: 25th November
entry.content: Mini-M squeaky clean with hair dried and brushed after shower time. We reckon she has got Auntie L's hair - it's exactly the same colour with the same awesome natural highlights.

entry.title: 24th November
entry.content:
It's a sad state of affairs when you have to write IoUs to your 3 year old to pay the bus fare…
Don't worry we're not actually living that skint - just that the buses around here don't give change and being thrifty Scots, there was no way £2 was going in the hopper for a £1.50 fare!

entry.title: 23rd November
entry.content: Ice skating! No broken bones - phew. There was shameless bribery with sweets to get Mini-M to go back on the ice after a wobbly start (for us all). However, by the end she was getting her balance and making plans for next time - specifically that I would have to save some sweets for next time. And theorising that the problem was really that Mummy and Daddy were too wobbly to help her very much - which is probably true…

entry.title: 22nd November
entry.content: There was a bake sale at work to raise money for Movember. I contributed a chocolate orange loaf cake - with a glitzy gold moustache on top, to get into the spirit of things.

entry.title: 21st November
entry.content: Christmas parties are on the horizon. Still fairly distant (although Mini-M is informing us on a daily basis that it is going to be Christmas soon) but now we are fully prepared and party-ready with sliver glittery mouse shoes! On a less pretty note, we were in the bathroom and Mini-M wanted to sing Christmas songs. I said no, since it was too early. She then tried to convince me that we had to, because (I quote) "It will help me do my poo, Mummy". I remain unconvinced!

entry.title: 20th November
entry.content: Experimental Smartprice ketchup caramelised onions. All will become apparent in a future blog post!

entry.title: 19th November
entry.content: Frosty car park at work - it didn't defrost all day.

entry.title: 18th November
entry.content: Mini-M has been telling us - normally as an alternative to going to sleep at the end of the day - that she has a sore tummy. When we ask her how long it has been sore for she says all the time. But it is never mentioned at any point during the day, she's happy and full of beans and doesn't seem in any obvious pain. So I'm leaning towards it being a bedtime delaying tactic. However…. we're having a happy/say tummy chart for a while just in case. Towards the end of the day Mini-M has to draw a happy or a sad face depending on how her tummy has been feeling. Today it was apparently sad - with tear because there is generally a fair amount of melodrama about life at the moment. Said whilst smiling… I'm fairly sure that toddlers are designed to cause maximum parent confuzzlement!

entry.title: 17th November
entry.content: Rocking the shower cap / bath flute combo. The sort of activity you can only really pull off when you're 3! (The recorder player in me has to point out that I think she's playing a b flat (sort of))

entry.title: 16th November
entry.content: At the Queen's Hall again - twice in less than 12 hours! This time we took Mini-M to watch some of the Edinburgh Light Orchestra rehearsal that Auntie L was playing in.

entry.title: 15th November
entry.content: They Might Be Giants - at the Queen's Hall, performing Birdhouse In Your Soul - thank you to Uncle P for babysitting and letting Mr E and myself be there - it was ace.

entry.title: 14th November

entry.title: 13th November

entry.title: 12th November
entry.content: Day of annual leave for Mr E and myself - day at nursery for Mini-M! A rare occurrence celebrated with a trip to David Bann's for lunch - this was the vegan (and hence dairy free) dessert that we shared. The coconut sorbet was amazing - mainly since it was heavily laced with rum :o)

entry.title: 11th November

Indeed you'd think that we'd have been completely unaware of bonfire night had Martha not enlightened us - she spent the whole evening saying "I told you there would be fireworks! I told you there would be bonfires!"

entry.title: 21st October
entry.content:
Went to ASDA to buy emergency nappies. Space was tight. Whilst getting out of car VERY carefully and gently, touched door of next car with mine. Looked - no damage. Guy was in car, and by this point banging on window. Did an apologetic wave. Man starts swearing, shouting, tooting horn etc. Decide not to hang about and disappear into ASDA. Come out 10 mins later to discover he has gone, having ripped off our fuel cover cap and air valve cover, (and presumably taken them with him, since I couldn't find them lying anywhere). At least I remembered the nappies...
!

entry.title: 20th October
entry.content: Mini-M being a little ambitious with her stone throwing (or indeed lifting) abilities!

entry.title: 19th October
entry.content: Continuing the wedding anniversary jaunt, today started with a long lie, a cooked breakfast, and time to lounge and read books - all three very rare occurrences, especially on a Saturday morning! Unfortunately this photos has somehow made Mr E look like he has disproportionately long legs, which isn't true, so on that basis I'm going to claim that it is also a quirk of the camera in yesterday's photo making my front teeth look ridiculously far apart!!!!

entry.title: 18th October
entry.content: Our 5yr wedding anniversary today. We took advantage of some grandparent baby-sitting to have a overnight jaunt up to St Andrews to celebrate / stock up on sleep. Given how cold and blustery it was on the beach, it was quite a relief not to have to walk at Mini-M speed - we'd have been frozen.

entry.content: Behaviour over the weekend was good (Mini-M's behaviour specifically, although I think Mr E and I did OK too) so that meant Peppa Pig was back. To celebrate, Mini-M chose to watch the Christmas special.

entry.title: 6th October
entry.content:
Safari Park! We had a super day at Blair Drummond with team Head.
I have to say that even in the car, I was a bit scared of the lions - they were so close to the road. And I'm REALLY glad that as we were driving round the rhinos were in their indoor pen!

entry.title: 5th October
entry.content: This is one of those weekends where everything seems to happen at once - so today has been a busy day. All 3 of us were on top of Arthur's seat by 9:30am, and we'd done a supermarket shop, got home and eaten lunch by 12! Embracing the hecticness, Mini-M and I then went to the matinee of Seven Brides for Seven Brothers, since there were bargain basement tickets going. We only stayed until the interval, but she sat enthralled for a good hour solidly before getting a bit antsy. The highlights (as recounted to Mr E when we got home): They did 18 cartwheels, it was really snowing on the stage, but it was just pretend snow Daddy, and they had flapjacks and bacon for breakfast only wearing blankets because their clothes were a bit smelly. Fairly sure most of the actual plot went over her head - probably for the best!

entry.title: 4th October
entry.content: I failed to take any photos today - but Mr E did: he and Mini-M were some of the 'VIP' soft play-ers at the opening of the new Portobello gymnastics and Clambers soft play centre. There was lots of ball-pool fun to be had - and the undoubted bonus of being part of the first cohort of kids to get let loose - it was all squeaky clean.

entry.title: 3rd October
entry.content: An inexplicably bad wrist day meant I had to go see what frozen things the HW student union had in their freezer to get some ice on it, I was hoping for peas - but it ended up being a choice between chips or chicken burgers. I wend with the chips - it earned me a few odd looks in the office!

entry.title: 2nd October
entry.content: Bus commuting after the car failed its MOT and we had to wait for the part to be ordered in.

One of my jobs - going to drop off Mini-M's painting at the new Tumbles Soft Play at Portobello - it was a winning entry in the draw to win VIP tickets to the opening of the centre of Friday - that's what Mini-M and Mr E will be doing whilst I'm at work!

There was beach picnicking, sandcastle building, paddling in vest and pants (just for Mini-M), and charity shopping. Mini-M hit the shops with her handbag, purse and pennies (the princely sum of £3) and chose to spend some of them on a Peppa Pig jigsaw tin. Thankfully when we got it home, it had its full complement of pieces - phew!

entry.title: 1st February
entry.content: Holiday planning to counteract the miserable weather lack of daylight and general doldrummy-ness of the back end of this week. Roll on spring!

entry.title: 31st January
entry.content: I didn't take a picture today. I didn't even manage a month without slipping up! Oh well - a spare photo from the day before instead of Princes Street in the rain from the top deck of the no. 34 bus going to work

entry.title: 30th January
entry.content: Today's picture is of the pressure cooker which is currently de-pressurising on the hob. And what's inside? Azerbaijan lamb stew for tomorrow night's tea.

entry.title: 29th January
entry.content: A fancy wall on the edge of the Heriot Watt University campus, just off the A71. The sort of wall that is unlikely to be specced in any modern boundary fencing requirements!

entry.title: 28th January
entry.content: Mini-M and Mr E both engrossed with the robot story cards.

entry.title: 27th January
entry.content: I have seasonally confused rhubarb! I hope it survives the rest of winter since it's still only January...

entry.title: 26th January
entry.content: Mini-M helping with some baking after my cold finally started to clear a little bit and I started to feel a bit more enthusiasm for doing things!

entry.title: 25th January
entry.content: Happy Burns Night! I hope you had haggis for your tea - we did - yum! Today's picture isn't of haggis. It's of some rather obstructive parking encountered on the way to work. I think this car started off 'parked' in it's driveway without the handbrake on and it then rolled slowly across the road until the roadworks stopped it! U turns were required all round - although thankfully I wasn't driving otherwise we'dprobably still be stuck there...

entry.title: 24th January
entry.content: Mini-M and Mr E proudly displaying the Selkirk Bannock they baked this afternoon. Nothing beats walking into the house after work being greeted with the smell of baking Bannock!

entry.title: 23rd January
entry.content: Now I'm the poorly one! I sniffed and sneezed my way through work today and am hoping I can do the same tomorrow! Right now I can't help thinking I should be asleep... Hoping I nod off soon but  for the meantime I'm listening to soporific things on my old school iPod!

entry.title: 22nd January
entry.content: Rubbish photo day today - picture taken from the bus on the way home. Burton's biscuit factory in Sighthill - the source of the amazing sweet biscuity smell when I came out of work today.

entry.title: 21st January
entry.content: The selection of books chosen for me by Mr E and Mini-M when they went on a poorly peoples' trip to the library earlier today. They both have a vicious snotty variety of lurgy - I am steering as clear as I can and dosing myself up on Berocca!

entry.title: 20th January
entry.content: Mini-M's been poorly today. It's been a day of slumping on the sofa with Jemima Puddleduck for cuddles, watching CBeebies repeats on iPlayer. Thankfully by tea time she was starting to perk up.

entry.title: 19th January
entry.content: "When I'm a little bit bigger Mummy I coming back and choosing this one" Really.....?

entry.title: 18th January
entry.content: Snow!!!! In Leith!!!

entry.title: 17th January
entry.content: This sums up my evening - not eating burgers but doing puzzles, watching tv, web browsing and eating toast. Brain dead tonight after an unpleasantly epic drive home from work... Off to bed now zzzzzzzzz!

entry.title: 16th January
entry.content: Red sky in the morning (and -6C on the car thermometer) shepherds' warning. This is the sunrise from my work car park.

entry.title: 15th January
entry.content: 1st day at new job today - then epic toddler tantrums when I got home. It's been a recurring theme recently (the tantrums, not starting new jobs every day!), so 15 mins with a Sharpie and some brown wrapping paper and we now have 'Martha's Big Behaviour Chart' on the wall. The idea is that if there's good or bad behaviour, then that earns a tally mark on the chart, and the aim is to have more good than bad at the end of the week...

entry.title: 14th January
entry.content: Today was a 1-day lull between jobs and I spent it catching up on odd jobs with a little bit of guiltily doing nothing too! Here's a view of Leith docks from the top of Ocean Terminal.

entry.title: 13th January
entry.content: Reading the ikea instructions during construction of the new bed.

entry.title: 12th January
entry.content: A very lovely and indulgent lunch at Prestonfield House - complete with pheasants strutting around outside! Thankyou wonderful babysitters for making it possible!

entry.title: 11th January
entry.content: Playing in the park in questionably suitable weather - but that's what wellies and puddle suits are for, right?

entry.title: 10th January
entry.content: My leaving cake at work. Going to miss everyone but new challenges ahead at SEPA

entry.title: 9th January
entry.content: St Andrew's square at twilight.

entry.title: 8th January
entry.content: Tree silhouettes on a lunchtime wander

entry.title: 7th January
entry.content: Because nothing says 7th January like Christmas pudding!

entry.title: 6th January
entry.content: Bedtime story - "Katie Morag And The Big Boy Cousins"

entry.title: 5th January
entry.content: This morning I cleared my desk! 5.5yrs of accumulated junk and now I need to find space at home for all my old uni textbooks - i foresee some shelf rearranging! New job starts imminently though... Big changes to start 2013.

entry.title: 4th January
entry.content: I'm bad at To-Do lists. Mr E is a To-Do list king. In 2013 I'm trying to do better! So I've made a list of 20 housework-y tasks to complete by the end of January, with the aim of doing one per day (in no particular order!), which allows me a little room for slacking...

entry.title: 3rd January
entry.content: Bed shopping in IKEA - Mini-M trying her soon-to-be big girl bed for size. She's not quite got the whole pillow thing sorted yet...

entry.title: 2nd January
entry.content: Mini-M sneaking a sprinkle after decorating some Mr Tumble inspired cupcakes.

entry.title: 1st January
entry.content: Trying out the new elbow and knee pads on the birthday bike which, 6 months later finally fits! Good job we were on the sand as the helmet is going to offer limited protection attached to the rucksack... Sunshine but so cold! Happy New Year!

entry.content: Argh! Zombie Lego man mysteriously doesn't eat humans, instead noms on a cooked chicken leg!
